noun.description: A sweet or savory dish made as a smooth light mass with whipped cream and beaten egg white, flavored with chocolate, fish, etc., and typically served chilled.
examples: roulade of sole with a lobster mousse

noun.description: A mass of tiny bubbles that forms on the top of a glass of champagne or sparkling wine.
examples: the Brut RÃ©serve possesses a wonderful creamy mousse of small, compact bubbles

noun.description: A light, foamy preparation used for styling hair.
examples: apply a dollop of volumizing mousse to the roots and work it in towards the ends of your hair
experiment with different styling products such as mousses and gels

noun.description: A brown frothy emulsion of oil and seawater formed by weathering of an oil slick.

origin: Mid 19th century: from French, moss or froth.
